review_title: Overall a good experience so far
pros:
-Nice and understanding people, reasonable work load, good prescription and health benefits, fair pay
-Get paid for on-call
cons:
-Like any healthcare facility it operates 24x7 so holidays are few and on-call can be intrusive at times.  It is hard to find time to work on enterprise systems since they can never go down without affecting somebody
-It is a smaller hospital so opportunities for advancement are few, people tend to stick with the company
-Employees do not get a discount at the cafeteria

pros: Since it is a small hospital, it’s easy to cross train in different modalities in radiology. It’s great experience. Most other hospitals don’t allow you to cross train until years after. Small and friendly. Everyone is like family.
cons: Lower compensation compared to more of the greater baton rouge area. Also, it seemed always understaffed. So I had to do a lot of unnecessary weekends to cover other full time employees vacation or sick days.

review_title: The employment served it purpose for the time I was there.
pros: I was employed for 18 years with the company. In the beginning, the hospital was run efficiently and cared for the employees but as most businesses do, this changed in years to come.
cons: Management at LRMC is about the money only. It lost the true meaning of compassion and caring for employees and clients.
